title: BBC Local Live: Channel Islands on Wednesday 11 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: uk-wide recruitment drive for jersey 's children 's service .
clinton pringle 's brother named after 'hero ' who tried to save him .
talks for 'genuine guernsey ' accreditation 'came to nothing ' .
ten deputies support assisted dying debate .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: our coverage across the channel islands has finished for the day .
we 'll be back on thursday from 08:00 with the latest news , weather , travel and sport .
do n't forget bbc channel islands news on bbc one at 18:30 and 22:30 .

documents.title: genuine jersey boss working with guernsey on 'golden ' brand
text: the head of genuine jersey says he has been working with politicians in guernsey to help them set up a local products brand .
genuine jersey was launched in 2001 by a group of businessmen as a way of promoting locally made produce such as jersey royals , milk and fudge .
it has since been extended to cover a range of products by over 100 companies .
guernsey is looking to establish its own version under the golden guernsey brand .
it is being led by deputy andrea dudley who was inspired by the jersey scheme .
it is a scheme that is working for jersey and i would think it would work for guernsey .
i will work with guernsey to set up the scheme and would be keen to see a scheme set up in guernsey .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: town indecent assault inquiry ongoing
text: a 37-year-old man arrested on sus of indecently assaulting another man in a town street in april is still on police bail , the force has confirmed .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: sark estate management would pay towards border control
text: sark estate management would pay for the cost of building a border post in sark according to the company 's chief executive .
the facility would allow the island to manage visitors from abroad without guernsey 's help .
kevin delaney says that his company would provide accommodation for border controllers if they were to come from outside of the island .
the president of guernsey 's home affairs committee says she has n't received any formal approach from sark 's chief pleas on the matter of border control .

deputy mary lowe says if a formal approach is made by sark , the committee would need to consider all implications such as the necessary legislation , resourcing , infrastructure and funding before making a decision .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: emotional wellbeing at the heart of new mental health plan
text: emotional wellbeing is at the heart of a new three year plan to deal with mental health problems in guernsey .
it is being launched by the island 's health and social care committee .
the plan aims to support islanders to manage their mental health better , and have services which help people get well .
health says its future services need to be appropriate , and flexible in the coming years , and the states has to take mental health as seriously as it does physical wellbeing .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: no charges to be brought following states credit card inquiry
text: no charges are to be brought following an investigation into the alleged misuse of a states corporate credit card , the law officers department has said .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: 'education ' is vital for stopping abuse says nspcc boss
text: the head of the nspcc is in jersey to see how the charity can help the states implement the recommendations of the independent jersey care inquiry , which published a report into decades of abuse in jersey 's care system 100 days ago .
nspcc ceo , peter wanless , is meeting with ministers to help ensure there 's a joined up approach between all organisations .
he also plans to share his knowledge about how other jurisdictions have improved their childcare .
he says the key is education .
the best way to end abuse and neglect of children is to stop it happening .
education is very important .
equipping young people with the knowledge of what is appropriate and what is n't appropriate is important .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: thousands raised for guernsey charity by harbour carnival
text: the 2017 guernsey harbour carnival raised more than £ 22,000 for local charities .

the hub 's sunflower project , which provides emotional support to children who have experienced bereavement or a serious illness in their family , is the main beneficiary of the fundraising event receiving half of the total .
the remaining 50 % of the money raised will be distributed by the guernsey round table to a range of local causes throughout the year .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: no prosecution over 'illegal ' credit card use
text: no one will face prosecution over an allegation a states of jersey credit card was used illegally .
the law officers ' department has reviewed the police report on the claims and has today said there 's insufficient evidence to prosecute .
an unnamed man in his 40s had helped police with their inquiries .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: nspcc boss in jersey to mark 100 days since care inquiry report
text: the chief executive of children 's charity nspcc is visiting jersey today to mark 100 days since the independent jersey care inquiry published its report .
peter wanless will meet with childcare officers to discuss the response to the report .
the inquiry made a number of recommendations aimed at keeping children safer in the island .
the states of jersey says it is making progress in implementing the proposals .
deputy chief minister , senator andrew green , says the hope is to show clear improvements in the care of children in the island .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: concern over move of outpatient service
text: guernsey 's health and social care committee ( hsc ) has expressed concern over the medical specialists group 's ( msg ) proposals to move its outpatients services .
hsc says moving to park place in town could have an impact on patients due to the extra distance from the princess elizabeth hospital .
msg claim its rare to admit outpatients to hospital and that the proposed new site is still a very short distance from the hospital .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: where is the tourism information centre ?
text: one in four people that found their way to the tourist information centre in jersey museum during the past 18 months have said they `` had difficulty '' finding it .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: protected status for products 'might not add up '
text: a number of guernsey businesses are concerned about the cost of bringing in a protected status for local artisan products .
there are calls for a scheme like genuine jersey to be introduced , backed by deputy andrea dudley owen from the committee for economic development .
but james le gallez from the haut maison liquor company said he was not sure it would be worth it as there would be costs involved in re-labelling products and signing up for the scheme .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: digital jersey looking at using buses to monitor air quality
text: speaking at the jersey chamber of commerce lunch , head of digital jersey , tony moretta , says they are looking at putting air quality sensors on libery bus vehicles to get a better idea of the quality of the air in the island .
air quality sensors on @ twitterid next project for jersey as a smart island- after @ twitterid of course @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: clinton pringle 's brother named after 'hero ' who tried to save him
text: the parents of a three-year-old who died after being run over in st helier have named their newborn son after the man who tried to save him .
michael and stacey pringle have named their son leyton francisco pringle as a tribute to francisco gouveia who tried to pull clinton from underneath the van that hit him in june 2016 .
rebekah le gal was sentenced for causing death by careless driving .
she was given a jail term of eight months suspended for two years .
michael pringle said it felt like a fitting tribute for a true hero .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: future customs post 'must not interfere with sark-guernsey route '
text: a senior sark politician has said any future customs post at maseline harbour must not interfere with the profitability of sark shipping .
the idea has been suggested many times as a way of enticing direct boat trip visitors , who would no longer need to transit through guernsey or jersey .

charles maitland , the chairman of policy and performance committee , said it was `` vital '' the island protects its lifeline shipping service , and the route between sark and guernsey was left untouched .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: tax cap seeks to breathe new life into open market
text: an injection of new life will be pumped into the open market , it is hoped , as proposals to bring the tax cap down on transactions to £ 50,000 has been put forward .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: aurigny financial position 'clearly unsustainable '
text: the latest guernsey budget predicted a loss of about £ 3.6m for the states-owned airline next year .
deputy gavin st pier said although it provides a `` lifeline '' to the island and alderney , steps would have to be taken for the future .
he said talks were ongoing between three senior committees of the states to make the necessary changes .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: residents 'will be consulted ' before road development
text: the constable of st helier has said it is too early for residents in la pouquelaye to be worried about potential changes to a road .
about 800 people have signed a petition against opening up patrick freely lane to traffic .
campaigners say it is a safety risk to children who use the lane to walk to school .
constable simon crowcroft said the money for the development of the road would go to the parish , and residents would be consulted by the roads committee before any work was done .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: businesses will not face extra energy charge until states debate
text: jersey businesses who generate their own electricity will not have to pay an extra charge for at least another six months , after the states voted to delay discussing it .
deputy carolyn labey raised concerns that the `` standby charge '' would discourage people from using wind or the sun to generate their own power .
jersey electricity , the island 's only provider , has agreed to delay introducing it until march , while states members investigate whether it needs to be regulated .
the charge is part of a scheme by the company to `` buy back '' excess energy businesses generate using their own equipment .
author: Chris Rayner
BBC Radio Jersey Political Reporter

documents.title: new mental health awareness plan put forward
text: emotional wellbeing is at the heart of a new three-year plan to deal with mental health problems in guernsey , according to the states mental health and wellbeing plan .
the health and social care committee said the plan aimed to encourage islanders to take their mental health seriously , to stop problems from getting worse .
among the committee 's aims are :
the release of the plan ties in with national mental health awareness week .
the full report can be seen here .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: local snapper receives international recognition
text: a winning image has won a local photographer a runner-up prize in an international competition .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: cheese maker supports 'genuine guernsey ' style scheme
text: an artisan cheese maker in guernsey has said she would support the idea of protected brand status for island made products , similar to the genuine jersey scheme .
fenella madison said it would help small producers , who could put stickers on their products to indicate their recognised quality .
the idea is also being backed by deputy andrea dudley owen from the committee for economic development .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: former care home future in question 100 days from abuse inquiry
text: there has been no decision yet on what will happen to the former children 's home haut de la garenne , but ministers have said jersey people will have a say in its future .
the home was the scene of many allegations of abuse , and featured strongly in the independent jersey care inquiry .
the inquiry 's final report , published a 100 days ago , suggested it should be demolished , but senator andrew green said it was just one option .
he said other suggestion included a living memorial or a park for young people .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: teenage biker injured in crash
text: a teenage motorcyclist was taken to hospital in the early hours following a crash in st saviour .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: a dry start , turning cloudy
text: a dry start to the day with bright and sunny spells .
but it will turn cloudy from late afternoon with a chance of some light rain of drizzle in the evening .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 62.6f ) .
in jersey :
in guernsey :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: ten deputies support assisted dying debate in states
text: ten deputies are supporting a request to have the issue of assisted dying debated in the states .
local campaigner sarah griffith recently sent a message to all deputies asking for the issue to be discussed .
she believes terminally ill islanders should have the option of ending their own lives .
deputy peter roffey is among them , who said it had been about 30 years since the issue had last been approached , and now was time to do so .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: les adams temporary traffic lights removed
text: temporary traffic lights at les adams in st peter have been removed , according the the states .
a spokesman said traffic is now flowing as normal .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: winners of pride of guernsey awards talk
text: winners of this year 's pride of guernsey awards spoke of their surprise and delight to have up their accolades .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: 'costs rise for small businesses '
text: small companies in jersey have seen a significant rise in their costs in recent times , with some passing it on to customers , according to the jersey statistics unit .
in this year 's business tendency survey , figures show 44 % of companies had to spend more to get hold of the products they sell .
of those , the report said 24 % increased the amount they charged customers as a result .
input costs indicator improved 16 pp since june , but still strongly negative .
44 % of businesses report higher costs .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: driver caused £ 2,000 damage
text: a car that slid along a road on its side caused nearly £ 2,000 worth of damage to a garden wall , the magistrate 's court was told .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: 'tangled ' dog rescued from shoreline
text: a dog which disappeared after chasing birds on rocks on jersey 's west coast has been rescued by fire crews .
felice 's owner called the fire service at about 10:00 on tuesday from the la pulente slipway .
felice was found `` tangled '' in her harness on the rocks between la pulente and le petit port , and was brought safely back to her owner .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: talks for 'genuine guernsey ' accreditation 'came to nothing '
text: the chief executive of a scheme which promotes jersey produce to consumers using a special label is calling on guernsey to create its own version .
john garton from the organisation genuine jersey said talks have taken place with guernsey states about setting up a scheme in the past , but have come to nothing .
he said the company was more than willing to help set up a guernsey version , and a channel islands `` super brand '' should also be considered .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: inter-island ferry route could work 'all year round '
text: a ferry company which wants to run an inter-island service has said the business is there to `` make it a success '' .
bachmann hr group is the latest of four companies to express an interest in running the service between jersey , guernsey and alderney .
jersey and guernsey 's governments recently joined forces to invite firms to put themselves forward to run the summer service in a bid to boost inter-island tourism .
chief officer nick saul said the route could be a success , and could even work `` all year round '' .
author: BBC Channel Islands News

documents.title: uk-wide recruitment drive for jersey 's children 's service
text: jersey 's children 's service is looking to recruit 18 more social workers , two senior practitioners and a team manager from the uk after recommendations were made in the independent jersey care inquiry panel 's final report .
the inquiry , which looked into historic child abuse in the island 's services for children , heard from more than 600 witnesses over the last three years .
its report , published on 3 july , concluded aspects were still not fully fit for purpose .
adverts for the jobs will be placed in the guardian and specialist social care publications .

jersey 's health minister senator andrew green said the states was committed to not only take on the recommendations , but ensure that jersey 's children received support `` throughout their lives '' .
he added when help was required , he wanted children to get it from a team that could `` act swiftly '' and that would always work with the interests of the child at heart .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: local live across the channel islands
text: good morning and welcome to bbc local live across the channel islands .
stay with us for all the latest news , weather , travel and sport for the day .
if you want to send in any photos or comments , please email us .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online
